metadata.title: CVE-2017-7186 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - low
metadata.description:
libpcre1 in PCRE 8.40 and libpcre2 in PCRE2 10.23 allow remote attackers tocause a denial of service (segmentation violation for read access, andapplication crash) by triggering an invalid Unicode property lookup.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-7186` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libpcre16-3 - 2:8.39-3
libpcre3 - 2:8.39-3
libpcre32-3 - 2:8.39-3
libpcrecpp0v5 - 2:8.39-3
pcregrep - 2:8.39-3
No subscription required

libpcre2-16-0 - 10.31-2
libpcre2-32-0 - 10.31-2
libpcre2-8-0 - 10.31-2
libpcre2-posix0 - 10.31-2
pcre2-utils - 10.31-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: pcre3 package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2:8.39-3').
pcre2 package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '10.31-2').
